title: The Study of points of view in Nathaniel Hawthorne's the blithedale romance
abstract: The Study of Point of View i n Nathaniel Hawthorne ?s The Blithedale Romance discusses about the way Hawthorne uses first-person point of view in this novel.The content consists of three studies of the first-person point of view: a study in the love triangle,a study in the heroines mystery,and a study in the Bl.ithedale community.The first study consists of three discussion:the description of love triangle,the intrusion of love triangle,and the climax of love triangle.The second study consists of three discussion also:the mystery of the heroines,the mystery between the heroines and Moodie,and the mystery between the heroines and Westervelt.The last study consists of three discussion: the practical life in the Blithedale community,the failure of the Blithedale community,and the individuality in the Blithedale community.Those discussion stress on the advantages and disadvantages in using first-person point of view,comparing with third-person point of view.
contributors: Prof. Dra. Ester Harijanti Kuntjara, MA., Ph.D. (Examination Committee 1)
source: Undergraduate Thesis No. 136; Ingrid Endrawati Adimasta (185006)
subjects: AMERICAN FICTION-19TH CENTURY; HAWTHORNE, NATHANIEL, 1804-1864. THE BLITHEDATE ROMANCE
